title: [Poll] People Who Like Supporting
body:
Just a data collection pool to see if we can give some feedback to Riot. 

Remember, like and comment so the post gets more attention. It'll increase the odds of a Red seeing it.

****PLEASE CLICK THE LINK INSTEAD OF ANSWERING THIS POLL. IT LOOPS TO A POST WITH A LESS BIASED TITLE****


http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/gameplay-balance/OG4l0X5t-poll-do-you-like-playing-support

Edit: Yeah, I screwed the title up, and I know the poll will be skewed as a result. My apologies.

Edit 2: I'm adding a link to a new with a less biased title.

replies.body:
Couple of things
I main the role and like it; I don't want to play it 40 times in a row (which I actually did in my climb to gold last season by picking fill).
Second this survey is biased; the people likely to look at this thread are support mains. Not saying it's a bad idea, just the execution could use some work.
Yeah, in hindsight, the title needs work, the question could be phrased better, and I really missed the mark on this one. Thanks for the feedback, though!
best thing about autofill is that fill now doesnt mean sup anymore.

Personally, I enjoy the role, but I fully acknowledge that I'm in the minority. Support lacks the visible carry potential that other roles have, and some people can have fun without that facet of League, but others can't, and they shouldn't be ignored.

I voted the first one based on my last two weeks of play (I hate saying I "main" anything. it changes, and I suspect it does for most people).

But, your poll isn't necessarily that informative. There's lots of people who enjoy support, and enjoy it consistently, but know it doesn't have equal impact on the game. 

Support exists as a position because there isn't enough xp and gold on the map to sustain a full fifth position. The items and strategies surrounding support have served as a means to alleviate that reality and try to allow a fifth full member to exist. It has contributed to the game because it allowed for some a-symmetry and that's interesting. 

That doesn't mean that the support player has an equal say in the game, though. To me, that's the key problem that needs fixing. Supporting is fun, supporting is helpful, but it doesn't carry the same impact as other roles. As such, it will always be a problem for queues and for the game. Riot needs to fix the harsh reality that a position with less xp and gold than other positions is going to be less helpful. It's just the cold, hard, truth.

> But, your poll isn't necessarily that informative. There's lots of people who enjoy support, and enjoy it consistently, but know it doesn't have equal impact on the game.

I fully admit, the poll is not to be taken as actual science. It has a significant unintentional bias due to the phrasing, and in hindsight, I could have executed it much better. And as to your point about supports not having as large an impact on the game, I would completely agree, to a point. At the higher levels of play, Supports have quite the impact on the game.
They do, but only in the context of team play. I stilly fully believe it's easier to carry as another role. Even in high elo, people don't want to support as often. There's a reason for that.

I currently enjoy the role but I feel they're in need of a class update the likes of which marksman/mages/assassins have received.

Currently support itemization is dated in comparison to new mechanics, and the older items are one of the things I think hold supports back. Sightstone feels pretty bad (imo) to keep vision up since it's basically hard countered by a free trinket and the enemies can force me off the map purely by playing the vision game without ever seeing me (feelsbadman, especially if you're an Enchanter with a chalice item because your HP/MP regen is high). Some updated mechanics specifically aimed at support gameplay would go a long way towards making the role feel better... some of the biggest problems right now:

**Super boring build paths.** All tank supports basically want to make the same items, all enchanter supports basically want the same items, even if they function completely differently than their counterparts, due to the high efficiency of the items when you include actives (Knight's Vow, Locket, Face, etc). 

**Lack of real safety.** Right now, it feels like the lanes need some love. It's currently very difficult (except for someone like Janna) to deal with towerdives in a meaningful way. With the increase in mobility and tanks entering the meta again with CotC, it can be very easy for the tank to assume and keep tower aggro through an entire dive and shrug said tower aggro off with shields from CotC. Everyone has experienced the 4-5man fiesta bottom lane, and it's not fun - either make other lanes more appealing to gank or make bot lane harder...

**Lack of champ diversity**. We haven't received any real, game-changing supports since Bard (2 years ago), and it would be really nice to see Riot put some effort into developing interesting supports, especially now that they have a better idea of what "classes" of supports they'd like to support (enchanters, vanguards, etc).

I love being a support main, although it has it's ups and downs. It feels great getting your ADC fed and watching them carry the game. Additionally, with the tweak that makes getting an S easier for supports, it's felt more rewarding. Although, sometimes we get blamed for the ADC's mistakes and it sucks overall in those kinds of games. That's probably my biggest annoyance when I play support.

Sampling bias :/ Not a lot of people who don't like support would be here, I think.

That said, I used to main support but got tired of not being able to communicate well with my adc, so I main top now. I feel like I do much better in the laning phase now.

To be honest, I feel that if you are a support main, most likely it is common for you to enjoy it, otherwise you wouldn't stay a support main. Personally, I really like the support role. However, I will add that I mostly play a duo bot lane, so I don't end up experiencing all the horror stories that other support mains have because I know my ADC really well. People often mention that "support" is a thankless role, and while that may be the case, I believe that most support mains aren't playing support for the glory. Sure it feels great to be the playmaker, to make that game winning "Madlife play" but I think there is more to the support mentality than that. I enjoy being a team player, helping my team in such a way that they are set up for success. Plus I enjoy shotcalling which works well in the support role.
